sourceNotes: Editorial guidance prepared by Pitchchat; not sourced from user submissions.
title: Blockchain Series A fundraising metrics benchmarks
summary: Series A blockchain benchmarks focus on sustainable business metrics alongside crypto-native indicators. Investors compare your fundamentals against both crypto protocols and traditional companies. These benchmarks demonstrate business maturity beyond token speculation. Pitchchat keeps fundraising metrics investor-ready in one room.

metrics.label: Protocol Revenue
metrics.note: Real fee revenue from protocol operations. The most important metric for sustainable economics. Growth trajectory matters.

metrics.label: Monthly Active Wallets
metrics.note: Unique active wallets monthly. Distinguish organic from incentivized. Retention and engagement quality matter.

metrics.label: Total Value Locked
metrics.note: For DeFi protocols. Organic TVL without unsustainable incentives. Composition and stability as important as size.

metrics.label: User Retention (90-day)
metrics.note: Users returning after 90 days, ideally without incentives. Proves genuine utility and product-market fit.

metrics.label: Revenue Growth Rate
metrics.note: Annual revenue growth. Crypto can grow faster but sustainability matters more than peak growth.

metrics.label: Net Revenue Retention
metrics.note: For protocols with measurable user economics. Shows users deepening engagement over time.

metrics.label: Governance Participation
metrics.note: Token voting participation. Indicates community engagement and decentralization credibility.

metrics.label: Security Audit Coverage
metrics.note: Comprehensive audit coverage from reputable firms. All critical findings addressed. Ongoing security program.

metrics.label: Institutional/Enterprise Users
metrics.note: Large users or enterprise integrations. Validates protocol maturity and security confidence.

metrics.label: Team Size
metrics.note: Scaled team across engineering, security, community, and business. Heavy on technical and security talent.
